page.title: 04 Killer Virus in Stafford.
page.content: The Legionnaires disease started in late April 1985.What caused the outbreak is still uncertain.It could have been a water cooling tower or a ventilation fan in the District Hospital.Scientists tests point to the water supply.The name of the bacteria is Legionella Pneumophila. The biggest proportion of the people who died were elderly.There were about 200 suspected cases.By May 31st, 39 people had died. The symptoms are difficulty with breathing,feeling weak and other 'flu' symptoms.The patients were helped to breathe using a ventilator machine and treated for other 'flu' symptoms. It isn't contagious and as yet there is no cure.At the moment this disease cannot be prevented. Some people avoided the Hospital and area during the outbreak.
